cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles NE of Havana, Cuba and 60 miles S of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move west-northwest into the central Gulf of Mexico, then curve northwest and turn northeast toward the Florida Big Bend coast and the southeastern United States.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Apalachicola–Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Tampa Bay to Apalachicola, then Georgia and the Carolinas Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty showers possible; only a 12% cumulative chance of sustained 34-kt winds over the next 5 days.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Mobile Bay given the forecast track well east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could produce 1–2 inches of rain mid-week, locally higher in heavier squalls.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased surf and rip-current risk along Alabama beaches during mid- to late-week.
